option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/kamoliddin/IdeaProjects/AppiumAndroidIosTest":"{\"/src/test/java/base/BaseTest.java\":\"This file appears to be a base class for an Android-based Appium test suite. It sets up the Appium driver, provides a method for long-pressing on a WebElement, and cleans up the driver after the test suite is complete.\\n\\n`BaseTest`: A base class that sets up and manages the Appium driver for Android-based tests.\\n\\n`ConfigureAppium()`: Configures the Appium driver with the necessary options and starts the driver.\\n\\n`LongPressAction(WebElement ele)`: Performs a long-press action on the specified WebElement using JavaScript execution.\\n\\n`tearDown()`: Closes the Appium driver and stops the Appium server (if started).\",\"/src/test/java/AppiumTest.java\":\"This file contains a single class and a single function:\\n\\n`AppiumTest`: This class extends the `BaseTest` class and contains a test case for testing the Wi-Fi settings functionality of an Android app.\\n\\n`WifiSettings`: This function performs the following steps:\\n1. Clicks on the \\\"Preference\\\" option.\\n2. Clicks on the \\\"3. Preference dependencies\\\" option.\\n3. Clicks on the Wi-Fi checkbox.\\n4. Clicks on the Wi-Fi settings option.\\n5. Verifies the title of the alert dialog.\\n6. Sends keys to the Wi-Fi settings input field.\\n7. Clicks on the \\\"OK\\\" button in the alert dialog.\",\"/pom.xml\":\"This file is a Maven project configuration file (pom.xml) for a Selenium Java project that includes Appium for Android and iOS testing. It defines the project\\u0027s dependencies, including TestNG for testing and the Appium Java client library. The project is set to use Java 11 as the compiler source and target.\\n\\nThere are no classes or functions defined in this file. The file is responsible for managing the project\\u0027s dependencies and build configuration.\",\"/src/test/java/LongPressTest.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`LongPressTest`: A test class that performs a long press gesture on a specific element in the Android app under test.\\n\\n`LoongPressGesture()`: A test method that navigates to the \\\"Expandable Lists\\\" section of the app, performs a long press on the \\\"People Names\\\" element, and verifies that the expected menu is displayed.\\n\\nThe file is a test class that demonstrates the use of the long press gesture in an Appium-based Android test automation framework.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a heading for a document about Appium with Java for Android. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file serves as a high-level introduction to the topic of using Appium, a popular mobile automation framework, with Java for testing Android applications.\",\"/src/test/java/ScrollTest.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function:\\n\\n`ScrollTest`: A test class that performs scrolling gestures on an Appium-based mobile application.\\n\\n`LoongPressGesture`: A test method that scrolls down the screen of the mobile application until it can no longer scroll further.\\n\\nThe file demonstrates how to use the Appium Java client library to perform scrolling gestures on a mobile application, without any prior knowledge of the application\\u0027s UI hierarchy.\"}"}
